text: The Ven Harold Stephen Sharpe (1886–1960) was an Anglican Archdeacon in Africa during the first half of the twentieth century. Sharpe was born in Beddington; and educated at St Edward's School, Oxford and Keble College, Oxford. He was ordained Deacon in 1910 and Priest in 1911.Crockford's Clerical Directory 1929–30 p1161 London: OUP, 1929 After curacies in Aston Brook and Handsworth he went out to Southern Africa as a missionary. He was the Director of the Mafeteng Mission from 1916 to 1923; Archdeacon of Basutoland from 1922 to 1924; Archdeacon of Pretoria from 1924 to 1931; and Archdeacon of Damaraland from 1932 to 1936. Returning to England he held incumbencies at Marsham (1936 to 1939); Ditchingham (1939 to 1943); Blairgowrie (1943 to 1946);"Scottish Episcopal Clergy, 1689–2000" Bertie, D.M p631: Edinburgh T & T Clark and South Perrott (1946 to 1951). He retired to Newton Ferrers where he died on 18 October 1960.Rev. Harold Sharpe. The Times (London, England), Friday, 21 October 1960; pg. 15; Issue 54908 ==References== Category:1886 births Category:People from Surrey (before 1965) Category:People educated at St Edward's School, Oxford Category:Alumni of Keble College, Oxford Category:20th-century Anglican priests Category:Archdeacons of Basutoland Category:Archdeacons of Pretoria Category:Archdeacons of Damaraland Category:1960 deaths
title: Harold Sharpe
